cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast along the Carolina coast, then turning northeast and accelerating offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina Outer Banks (Cape Lookout–Cape Hatteras area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (and Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket and Martha’s Vineyard MA
weather_observation.warning_coast: North Carolina/Virginia border to Chincoteague VA, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point southward; Storm Surge Warning Savannah River SC to Poquoson VA including Hampton Roads
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina through North Carolina and southeast Virginia (Hampton Roads) then continuing offshore toward New England
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (forecast 3–8 inches for far SE Virginia)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (2–4 ft possible, locally above 3 ft in Hampton Roads)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–57 mph, gusts 60 mph+) possible Friday with a 33% peak onset probability
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground expected in Hampton Roads and lower Chesapeake Bay as early as Friday morning, accompanied by large waves
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Friday could deliver 3–8 inches, producing localized flash flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands
